transcript: there's four distinct positions you can have in any Market you can have bargain which is the absolute cheapest one the next is best value the third position the marketplace is premium and then the fourth position in the marketplace is luxury where the price has no cap part of the value of the product itself is the cost that people know you paid to get it it's where people associate their status with the purchase they made and what an amazing position to be I just raise my prices even more and people want to buy more and so there's called veblin Goods in economics they actually defy the supply demand curve rules because typically when you raise prices you decrease volume but in luxury goods when you raise prices you increase how many you sell
